results.title: Andrea Bocelli: a night in Tuscany [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David Amphlett, Lana Topham, Propaganda Films and Insieme SRL
results.brief_description: On a warm September night at the Piazza dei Cavalieri in the ancient city of Pisa, Tuscany, the voice that has captured the hearts of millions, Andrea Bocelli, performed as part of a momentous outdoor event in his home town. He was joined on the stage for duets by Nuccia Focile, Sarah Brightman and Zucchero, as they presented an assortment of classical and popular ballads. Songs perfomed include; “Nestle dorma”, “La Donna e mobile”, “Lamento di federico”, “O Soave fanciulla”, “Brindisi”, “Torna a surriento”, “O Sole mio”, “Con te partiro”, “Romanza”, “E Chiove”, “Voglio restare cosi”, “Caruso”, “Misrere”, and “Time to say goodbye”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Amphlett, Lana Topham, Propaganda Films and Insieme SRL

results.title: Andre
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Annette Handley, Adam Shapiro and Kushner-Locke Production
results.brief_description: Andre, an adorable seal is orphaned when his mother is caught in a fishing net. The harbour master, his wife and three children adopt the lovable pup and nurse him back to health. Andre forms a special relationship with seven year-old tomboy Toni and the two prove that true friendship can survive the toughest trials.

results.title: Andersonville
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, David W. Rintels and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: Andersonville was the notorious Confederate prison where Union soldiers were kept as prisoners of war. It is a place where men who once fought alongside each other now kill for the shirts off their backs. Sergeant McSpadden (Frederic Forrest) and Josiah Day (Jarrod Emick) lead a fearless band of men against the brutality of the most notorious prison of its time and the savagery of its inmates. Hunted like animals and tortured without mercy, they must trust in each other and be willing to sacrifice their own lives for the chance to escape. Frankenheimer creates a powerful portrayal of the struggle for freedom where the only law is the law of survival.

results.title: And your mother too! = Y tu mama tambien
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Cuaron, Producciones Anhelo, Good Machine and Besame Mucho Picures
results.brief_description: Alfonso Cuaron shocked and delighted audiences with his third feature, a return to his native Mexico and a return to form. Principally this is the story of two horny teenagers who take a road trip with an older woman in search of a mythical beach. But Cuaron makes his film much more than just “‘American Pie’ in Spanish” (as it is was crudely dubbed in some reviews), creating a clever, funny and provocative work that comments on the irascible nature of teenage friendship and the class delineations of Mexican society whilst retaining scintillating repartee between the leads (Diego Luna and Gael Garcia Bernal riff off each other in a delightfully tangential fashion) and by being downright sexy.

results.title: And you act like one too
results.brief_description: A woman who feels neglected by her family on her 30th birthday has an affair with a man she meets that day only to find her family have organised a surprise party.

results.title: And yet it moves
results.brief_description: This film provides a look at how animators use their imagination; it also shows the materials they use. The film is divided into sections which show the creation of brief but effective story lines or commentaries in various media. Plasticine becomes a gracefully moving woman; another blob becomes a comic singer complete with cape; an egg revolves, bounces and catches fish.

results.title: And what of the future?
results.creator_credit: David Allen, Robert qAlbury and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Investigates some of the social consequences of microelectronics in relation to employment, the work ethic, and the individual’s right to provacy as the amount of computerized information grows.

results.title: And what about sugar ?
results.brief_description: This film glosses over the adverse effects of the consumption of sugar by implying that sugar is good for you in controlled doses, and that proper tooth care, rather than diet will prevent dental cavities. No other credits available.

results.title: And we're going. 4. To Toledo = I ya vamos. 4. A Toledo
results.creator_credit: Joshua Tree Productions and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film. Provides some cultural background of Spain and points out to the students the difference between Spanish spoken by Spanish Americans and Spanish spoken in Spain.

results.title: And they named it Holland
results.creator_credit: Gerard J. Raucamp and Carillon Films
results.brief_description: Provides aerial views of Holland, without commentary. Illustrates the variety of environment contrasting old and new, urban and rural, highlighting the diversity of life in a small and densely populated country.
